alert.note: Alert for Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 10:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in South Central Ohio, Pike and Ross. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Use caution near creeks and streams as water rises. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Waverly, Piketon, Kingston, Bainbridge, North Folk Village, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Frankfort, Clarksburg, Knockemstiff, Summithill, Bourneville, Massieville, Buchanan, Scioto Trail State Park, Lattaville, Lake White, Pike County Airport and Idaho.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
